ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: to your heart so you would be one of the Warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: To (communicate) to your heart that you may be a warner
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: to your heart that you might become one of those who warn (others on behalf of Allah),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: to your heart, so that you will warn (the people of the dangers of disobeying God).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Upon your heart, for you to convey warning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Upon your heart that you may be (one) of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Upon your heart that you may be of the warners
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: upon thy heart, that thou mayest be one of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Upon thy heart, that thou mayst be (one) of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: into your heart, so that you may be a warner,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Upon thy heart, that thou mayest be of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: upon your heart (so that you may be one of the warners),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: To thy heart and mind, that thou mayest admonish.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Upon your heart (O Muhammad SAW) that you may be (one) of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: upon your heart (Prophet Muhammad), in order to be one of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Upon your heart, that you may be one of the warners.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:194] upon your heart, that you may be [one] of the warners,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Upon your heart) according to your memorisation; it is also said that this means: when it was recited to you, (that thou mayst be (one) of the warners) by means of the Qur'an,
